thread.title: Lakers vs. Warriors Christmas game record 8.32 million views reviving NBA ratings amid recent viewership slump
thread.title_full: Lakers vs. Warriors Christmas game record 8.32 million views reviving NBA ratings amid recent viewership slump

author: Reign Amurao
title: Lakers vs. Warriors Christmas game record 8.32 million views reviving NBA ratings amid recent viewership slump
text:

Lakers vs. Warriors Christmas game record 8.32 million views reviving NBA ratings amid recent viewership slump Discuss Now Lakers vs. Warriors record 8.32 million views on Christmas Day (Image source: Imagn) According to the NBA, the games during the holiday were highly viewed, especially the Lakers vs. Warriors game. Fans flocked to televisions on Christmas Day to watch five games, including the LA Lakers vs. Golden State Warriors matchup. The league reported that the five-game special netted the highest viewership in Christmas in five years.
On Wednesday, five games featured the Lakers, Warriors , Phoenix Suns, Denver Nuggets, Minnesota Timberwolves, Dallas Mavericks, Philadelphia 76ers, Boston Celtics, New York Knicks, and San Antonio Spurs.
Across all games, the league reportedly averaged 5.25 million viewers per game in the U.S. alone. The game with the most views was the Lakers vs. Warriors game, which averaged 7.76 million viewers. The game's peak had 8.32 million viewers, which became the most-watched Christmas Day game in five years.
Trending â€¢

The two teams featured some fan-favorite players, LeBron James and Steph Curry. Their bout was close as the Lakers had a narrow 115-113 win over the Warriors. James had 31 points, four rebounds, and 10 assists on 54.5% shooting.
Curry didn't back down and kept up with his old rival. He had 38 points and six assists. The Warriors star shot 53.3% from behind the arc, attempting 15 shots.
